sx360::sxIterator

Public Attributes
sxEvent *  recordChangeEvent

sxIterator is responsible for traversing a sxPunchFile and returning sxRecords for reading or writing.  A sxIterator is automatically created when a sxPunchFile is opened in READ or READ_WRITE mode.  It is not generated if the file is opened in CREATE mode, since the class needs to know how many records are present when the file is opened.  sxIterator is not flexible in the regard of adding new records to an existing sxPunchFile.

Member Function Documentation

int sxIterator::getCurrentIndex (
 )  const

Returns the 0 based index of the current sxRecord.

sxRecord * sxIterator::first (
 ) 

Moves to the first record in the file. Returns NULL if not valid.

sxRecord * sxIterator::last (
 ) 

Moves to the last record in the file. Returns NULL if not valid.

sxRecord * sxIterator::next (
 ) 

Moves to the next record in the file. Returns NULL if not valid.

sxRecord * sxIterator::previous (
 ) 

Moves to the previous record in the file. Returns NULL if not valid.

bool sxIterator::write (
 ) 

Writes the current record to the file only if the file was open in READ_WRITE mode. Returns whether the write was successful.

sxRecord * sxIterator::gotoRecord ( size_t  i  ) 

Moves to the 0 based record specified by i. Returns NULL if not valid.

sxRecord * sxIterator::gotoRecord ( sxIndex *  idx,


size_t  i  

)


Moves to a record id using an index. Returns an sxRecord if found or NULL if not found.

sxIndex* idx = the index for searching

size_t i = the id of the record that is being searched. This is in contrast to the above implmentation that is the 0 based index of the record being searched.


Member Data Documentation

sxEvent* sx360::sxIterator::recordChangeEvent

Assign a sxEvent to this member to have a custom function executed whenever the sxIterator moves off of the current record.  See the documentation for sxEvent for more detail on usage.
